Summary I'm a filmmaker and designer with a background in digital marketing (I was part of the team that launched Yahoo! into the UK and have remained very involved in 'digital' ever since). I learnt the craft of filmmaking at The London Film School and set up my own production company almost a decade ago. I shoot with all kinds of cameras from DSLRs and the Canon C300 for documentary work to the Alexa and 35mm for fancy cinematography. I'm an Adobe CC fan and work with Premiere Pro, After Effects, Speedgrade, Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign to create my films and graphics. I particularly enjoy documentary filmmaking, and respect the privilege of being given intimate access to people and worlds I would not otherwise see by telling their stories in as true and sensitive a way as possible. Beautiful imagery is a passion of mine. The way in which lighting, composition, colour palettes, graphics and typefaces work together is important to me. Europe 2005  – Present (10 years) London, United Kingdom • Overall responsibility for Developing Mobile & Communications partnerships across EMEA. Director Strategic Partners T-Mobile 1996  –  2003  (7 years) Business Unit Director with full P & L responsibility for all wholesale relationships within T-Mobile This role involved the development of a long term sales and marketing wholesale strategy designed to achieve a “step change” in subscriber growth, targeted at moving T-Mobile from No 4 to No 1 network within 5 years. This strategy proved highly successful and T-Mobile is now the No. 1 network in the UK. With a team of 50 people, this role oversaw business development, marketing, operations, finance & support.  
 
Achievements included: 
• Grew revenues from circa £500k to in excess of £200m in 4 years 
Delivered the successful launch of the Virgin Mobile joint venture – The world’s most successful MVNO - as well as overseeing the ongoing interface with T-Mobile as a shareholder. (Also served on the Board of Virgin Mobile) 
• Negotiated a complex and far-reaching wholesale contract with the UK’s largest fixed lined telco - BT – worth in excess of £50m 
• Negotiated & delivered Carphone Warehouse’s wholesale launch under the “Value Telecom” brand, worth in excess of £30m 
• Steered a company wide initiative to overhaul T-Mobile’s wholesale systems and processes to achieve “best in class” capabilities. This was achieved ahead of schedule. Director Strategic Partners T-Mobile UK 1996  –  2003  (7 years) I ran the UK arm of T-Mobil's wholesale business, including the relationship with Virgin Mobile.
